api_pyflakes module¶

API for the command-line I{pyflakes} tool.

Functions:

check(codeString, filename[, reporter])

Check the Python source given by C{codeString} for flakes.

checkPath(filename[, reporter])

Check the given path, printing out any warnings detected.

checkRecursive(paths, reporter)

Recursively check all source files in C{paths}.

iterSourceCode(paths)

Iterate over all Python source files in C{paths}.

main([prog, args])

Entry point for the script “pyflakes”.
api_pyflakes.check(codeString, filename, reporter=None)¶

Check the Python source given by C{codeString} for flakes.

@param codeString: The Python source to check. @type codeString: C{str}

@param filename: The name of the file the source came from, used to report

errors.

@type filename: C{str}

@param reporter: A L{Reporter} instance, where errors and warnings will be

reported.

@return: The number of warnings emitted. @rtype: C{int}

api_pyflakes.checkPath(filename, reporter=None)¶

Check the given path, printing out any warnings detected.

@param reporter: A L{Reporter} instance, where errors and warnings will be

reported.

@return: the number of warnings printed

api_pyflakes.checkRecursive(paths, reporter)¶

Recursively check all source files in C{paths}.

@param paths: A list of paths to Python source files and directories

containing Python source files.

@param reporter: A L{Reporter} where all of the warnings and errors

will be reported to.

@return: The number of warnings found.

api_pyflakes.iterSourceCode(paths)¶

Iterate over all Python source files in C{paths}.

@param paths: A list of paths. Directories will be recursed into and

any .py files found will be yielded. Any non-directories will be yielded as-is.

api_pyflakes.main(prog=None, args=None)¶

Entry point for the script “pyflakes”.
